qas.question: How did al-Mahdi maintain contact during his Occultation?

answers.text: acted as agents between him and his followers

qas.question: What would believers do when they had a problem?

answers.text: write their concerns and send them to his deputy

qas.question: What would the deputy endorse the concerns with?
What did the deputies collect in the Imam's behalf?

context: During the Minor Occultation (Ghaybat al-Sughrá), it is believed that al-Mahdi maintained contact with his followers <a0_0>via deputies<a0_0/> (Arab. an-nuwāb al-arbaʻa or "the Four Leaders"). They represented him and <a1_0>acted as agents between him and his followers<a1_0/>. Whenever the believers faced a problem, they would <a2_0>write their concerns and send them to his deputy<a2_0/>. The deputy would ascertain his verdict, endorse it with his <a3_0>seal and signature<a3_0/> and return it to the relevant parties. The deputies also collected <a4_0>zakat and khums<a4_0/> on his behalf.
